articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA and ILLIA NOVIKOV
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine fired several American-supplied longer-range missiles into Russia, officials said Tuesday, marking the first time Kyiv used the weapons that way in 1,000 days of war.
articles.title: Ukraine fires several US-made longer-range missiles into Russia for the first time

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday formally lowered the threshold for Russia’s use of its nuclear weapons, a move that follows U.S.
articles.title: Putin lowers the threshold for using his nuclear arsenal after Biden's arms decision for Ukraine

articles.author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB, WAFAA SHURAFA and FATMA KHALED
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — A United States envoy said an agreement to end the Israel-Hezbollah war is “within our grasp” after talks in Lebanon on Tuesday. However, there was no such optimism in the Gaza Strip, where the looting of nearly 100 aid trucks by armed men worsened an already severe food crisis.
articles.title: US envoy says Israel-Hezbollah truce is 'within our grasp' as Gaza food crisis worsens after looting

articles.author: FATIMA HUSSEIN and AMANDA SEITZ
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday tapped Dr. Mehmet Oz, a former television talk show host and heart surgeon, to head the agency that oversees health insurance programs for millions of older, poor and disabled Americans.
articles.title: Trump chooses TV's Dr. Oz to run Medicare and Medicaid, Wall Street exec Lutnick for Commerce

articles.author: REGINA GARCIA CANO and JORGE RUEDA
articles.description: CARACAS, Venezuela (AP) — The U.S. government recognized Venezuelan opposition candidate Edmundo González as the “president-elect” of the South American country on Tuesday, months after President Nicolás Maduro claimed to have won the July election.
articles.title: US recognizes Venezuela's opposition candidate as president-elect months after the disputed election

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK and JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — New York prosecutors oppose any effort to dismiss President-elect Donald Trump’s hush money conviction, but they expressed openness Tuesday to delaying sentencing until after his second term.
articles.title: Prosecutors oppose tossing Trump’s hush money conviction but are open to sentencing delay

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump, surrounded by family members, aides and allies trekked to Brownsville, Texas, on Tuesday where he listened intently to Elon Musk as the world's richest man showed the president-elect how he prepared to test his company's Starship rocket.
articles.title: Trump and Musk solidify their bond with Texas trip for rocket launch

articles.author: PATRICK WHITTLE
articles.description: A powerful storm is bearing down on the West Coast and bringing with it a scary-sounding weather term - bomb cyclone.Bomb cyclone is a term used by weather enthusiasts to describe a process that meteorologists usually call bombogenesis.
articles.title: What is a 'bomb cyclone'?

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: SpaceX on Tuesday launched another Starship rocket, but passed up catching the booster with giant mechanical arms.
articles.title: SpaceX launches giant Starship rocket, but aborts attempt to catch booster with mechanical arms

articles.author: TARA COPP, KEVIN VINEYS and AARON KESSLER
articles.description: CANNON AIR FORCE BASE, N.M. (AP) — Over a New Mexico training range named the Hornet, two Osprey aircraft speed 100 feet off the ground, banking hard over valleys and hills as they close in on a dusty landing zone.
articles.title: The Osprey's safety issues spiked over five years and caused deaths. Pilots still want to fly it
